intro: Borreria kotschyana, commonly known as desert star or mountain star, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellow flowers and hairy, succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Borreria kotschyana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
